head.title: Of, By and For the Public

series.series.name: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: ASTOR PLAZA

hedline.hl1: Of, By and For the Public

block.p: Now that Shakespeare in the Park has ended its season, the Joseph Papp Public Theater is presenting its performances outdoors in an entirely different setting.
Today, stages will be set up along Lafayette Street between East Fourth Street and Astor Place for "A Street Celebration of the Arts in Our Community," sponsored by the Public Theater.
Now that Shakespeare in the Park has ended its season, the Joseph Papp Public Theater is presenting its performances outdoors in an entirely different setting.
Today, stages will be set up along Lafayette Street between East Fourth Street and Astor Place for "A Street Celebration of the Arts in Our Community," sponsored by the Public Theater.

We have all these great poets, musicians and actors, so we thought we'd spill out into the neighborhood to let people know what we're really about," said Donna Walker-Collins, director of community affairs for the theater, which is at 425 Lafayette Street.

The street festival will include performances from the first production of the Public Theater's fall season, "Bring In 'Da Noise, Bring In 'Da Funk," which Ms. Walker-Collins described as "an exploration of the history of the beat through tap and rap," as well as community-based performing arts groups like the Theater for the New City, the World Music Institute and the Nuyorican Poets Cafe.
Forty vendors will sell everything from T-shirts to books to food from local restaurants.
Lafayette Street between East Fourth Street and Astor Place; today, noon to 6 P.M.; rain date: tomorrow; free; (212) 539-8643.
PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: ASTOR PLAZA
